meanings.definition: To deliberately annoy or taunt someone in order to provoke a reaction.
meanings.sent1: The kids were baiting their friend by making fun of his shoes.
meanings.sent2: She was baiting her little brother by hiding his favorite toy.
meanings.sent3: During recess, the students were baiting each other playfully.
meanings.sent4: The comedian was baiting the audience with his witty jokes.
meanings.sent5: The bully enjoyed baiting others to get a reaction.

meanings.definition: Food used to entice fish or other animals to be caught.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen prepared the baiting to catch some fish.
meanings.sent2: The cat eagerly pounced on the baiting left out for it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found the baiting and happily nibbled on it.
meanings.sent4: The bird swooped down to grab the baiting from the ground.
meanings.sent5: The baiting attracted a school of fish in no time.

meanings.definition: The act of setting a trap or lure to attract prey.
meanings.sent1: The hunter carefully placed the baiting to catch the deer.
meanings.sent2: The spider spun its web, using the baiting to lure insects.
meanings.sent3: The cunning fox devised a plan involving baiting to catch the chickens.
meanings.sent4: The fisherman cast his line with the baiting into the water.
meanings.sent5: The baiting was strategically positioned to attract the hungry bear.
